page.title: 13HAMPDEN PARK LEVEL CROSSING
page.content: A level crossing is a place where a railway crosses a road.I think that the Hampden Park Level Crossing is one of the busiest in the country. It causes a traffic jam by holding up traffic coming from three directions. The roundabout which also has several branches, Brassey Avenue via the shops and Lottbridge Drive.Some people think they ought to build a bridge over the railway for cars.This is not possible, partly as it would cost thousands of pounds and partly because the ground is level and all built on.The automatic lifting barriers cover the whole road.This is controlled by a button which the signalman presses when a train is coming.There is a double warning system(lights and a bell).When two trains arrive simultaneously there is a big queue.{ { By Donovan Sellings aged 10
